intro: Potentilla cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf cinquefoil, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and rocky soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are attractive to birds. Potentilla cuneata is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local wildlife.
